history.content:
Units on your UCB transcript can only be provided by faculty at UCB. If you and your PI were able to get a faculty member who would agree to review your research contribution and submit a P/NP grade based on that review and direction from the PI at the end of the semester, that would probably work out.

---

Additionally, I haven't found research units to really be necessary for anything. Any application you submit will include a resume or CV that will provide a lot more information than "supervised independent study". Very very few students struggle to reach the 120 required units to graduate.

Units on your UCB transcript can only be provided by faculty at UCB. If you and your PI were able to get a faculty member who would agree to review your research contribution and submit a P/NP grade based on that review and direction from the PI at the end of the semester, that would probably work out.
How would I go about getting units for research done with staff at LBNL? The PI that I will be working with is NOT faculty at UC Berkeley. Is this possible?
history.subject: Research Units
